reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Resort was great! Pool and beach lovely and we were obviously there in the off season and the place was dead - it was like we had it to ourselves.
reviews.title: Well - I had a wonderful time!

reviews.text: A majority of the guests that were there were Russian so there wasn't too many people to chat too - but I did notice that being an Australian helped your communication with Vietnamese and def the staff there because on my travels I saw quite a few Vietnamese people that had quite good english pretend that they couldn't understand what people were saying because they were trying to be difficult. So not sure if this was the case with some of the previous comments but we found the staff to be lovely and we had some great chats with the restaurant staff throughout our meals. A waiter at the beachcomber bar was very funny and entertained us with some excellent Michael Jackson moves. What more could you ask for?
reviews.title: All for rest!

reviews.text: Only issue was that they were used to the tight guests drinking nothing but water with their meals (current summer special was all 3 meals included with the normal nightly rate) so we always had to ask for a drink at dinner rather than being offered!
reviews.title: Great Hotel to Relax for both Adult and Child
A bad experience
reviews.text: We liked it so much we actually spent an extra night there!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our splurge after travelling on the semi cheap for the previous 18 days...
reviews.title: Very good hotel, best beach in Nha Trang

reviews.text: This has to be one of the best kept secrets in Asia. A secluded, private island, coconut palms, sandy beach, Buddhist Pagoda Temple, private bay, two gorgeous pools, three buffets offering wide selection (with enough salads and fruits and veggies to make even a vegetarian put on weight! ), lovely room, internet cable socket (superb speed) huge shower plus bath, TV with movie channels, and lots to do. We did tennis and biking and jet skis. The staff are friendly and make you feel special 24/7. To get to the island you take a dedicated speed boat or cable car- all free for guests. And the best part of our stay? The food was ALL FREE!! (Three meals a day). Not sure how long that offer lasts-as it seemed too good to be true, and yet it was true. I left my tel adaptor in the room and they arranged for a car to bring it to the airport- at no cost to me. I shall return!
reviews.title: Heaven on earth

reviews.text: 1 night at Vinpearl in May 2009. Very clean and new, but quite sparse .. we were the only ones on the beach and pool. Beach is pretty and clean, great for relaxation especially during low season when we went. The pool's enormous. The buffet breakfast is absolutely awesome. The rooms are a bit small but they're clean, new, and get checked twice a day I believe.
reviews.title: pretty, new hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Vinpearl amusement park is small, but gets more crowded on weekends due to locals, so avoid weekends. Also beware of locals who can be pushy and uncivilized-acting in the amusement park. The aquarium is awesome.
reviews.title: Totally over-rated

reviews.text: Food .. pretty sad on the island, you may need to return to the mainland to grab dinner. Unless you're interested in eating overpriced seafood on the island, or other overpriced hotel food. The cable car to mainland runs until 9 on weekdays, 10 on weekends, and the speedboat is about every half-hr, 24-7. Also remember you must ride a golf-car type shuttle from the hotel to the amusement park so you can catch the speedboat / cable car to the mainland, so there's a lot of transferring between transportation modes if you want to stay at Vinpearl.
reviews.title: Truly Superb!

reviews.text: As soon as we checked in and walked around Vinpearl property, we regretted our decision. I so wanted to go back to Whale Island. The food wasn’t good, at all, and extremely over-priced. The beach was almost completely gone, we were amazed at the erosion. The whole place looked somewhat rundown. It’s sad. Vinpearl was nothing like it once had been.
reviews.title: Wow!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I with another couple stayed for three nights 4 days, the booking in facilities were great we enjoyed the cable car getting there and like previous comments did not find any helpfull signs where to go to the hotel.
reviews.title: Needs to be improved

reviews.text: The rooms were on the small size compared to other simular hotels we have stayed at, the grounds were very good and well looked after, great for kids.
reviews.title: A five star tropical paradise.

reviews.text: The food was the downfall, the type and variaty was excelent but for some reason the chef made it all taste the same!! We all did not enjoy the food whilst being there and thought next time we stay in town and spend the money on restaraunts.
reviews.title: Was good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My brother and I were in Nha Trang for our younger brother's wedding to a beautiful young Vietnamese woman and decided to spend one night at the Vin Pearl to see what their 5 star hotel was like.
reviews.title: Luxurious. Amazing beach. Amazing deal.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were not disappointed in any way. Our room was immaculately clean, quiet as a tomb and had an incredible view of the ocean and beach. When we checked in they asked if we wanted an ocean view room in the Deluxe building or the Executive building. I asked what difference it made and was informed that all the rooms and furnishings were newer in the Executive building. The difference was $20 so I asked for a Grand Deluxe Ocean View room.
reviews.title: A B-Grade horry movie run by Basil Fawlty...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at Vin Pearl three times over the past few years. Generally, we are pretty pleased with the resort and its facilities.
reviews.title: Relaxing Island Resort

reviews.text: The good stuff:
reviews.title: Our best family holiday ever

reviews.text: - On an island facing towards the sea so the beach is very private and not crowded
reviews.title: Our best family holiday in Vietnam

reviews.text: - Huge outdoor swimming pool
reviews.title: best part of our Vietnam holiday

reviews.text: - Pretty spacious guest rooms which are adequately furnished
reviews.title: Flawless family holiday. Kids said it was the best yet
